messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Shingen or Nobunaga
messages.msgSnippet: Right. But the point is that it SAYS Takeda Shingen. Several people weighed in with their opinions of who it was (correct or incorrect), and those who were
messages.messageBody:
Right.

But the point is that it SAYS Takeda Shingen. Several
people weighed in with their opinions of who it was
(correct or incorrect), and those who were correct
didn't explain WHY. That's not helpful to those they
are trying to correct. Regardless of if you could
recognize the armor/helmet, etc. IT'S GOT THE GUY'S
FREAKING NAME ON IT!!

I would think that even if you had no idea about
Japanese history or Takeda Shingen, before you went
hawking it you'd at least try to get someone to
translate the darn Japanese on it.

Nate
--- Scott <scottc_4@...> wrote:
> Even if you cannot read the Kanji one should easily
> be able to tell
> that is in fact Takeda Shingen. There is no
> mistaking that very
> unique and very famous kabuto (helmet) of his.
>
>

messages.subject: Shingen or Nobunaga
messages.msgSnippet: Even if you cannot read the Kanji one should easily be able to tell that is in fact Takeda Shingen.  There is no mistaking that very unique and very famous
messages.messageBody:
Even if you cannot read the Kanji one should easily be able to tell
that is in fact Takeda Shingen. There is no mistaking that very
unique and very famous kabuto (helmet) of his.
